summary: This document is an email chain from July 29, 2019, forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It contains a message from a Berlin-based individual alleging that Deutsche Bank AG helped Jeffrey Epstein move illicit funds and that German authorities, including Finance Minister Olaf Scholz, are obstructing justice by protecting the bank and ignoring requests to submit evidence.

persons.name: Olaf Scholz
persons.context: Mentioned by the Berlin correspondent as a top-level German government authority who is stubbornly supporting Deutsche Bank AG, which is implicated in helping Jeffrey Epstein move dirty money.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the U.S. v. Epstein case. The correspondent alleges Deutsche Bank AG helped him move his dirty money out of the USA.

connections.description: The correspondent alleges Deutsche Bank AG played a key role in Epstein's dirty business by helping him move his dirty money out of the USA.
The correspondent claims the German Finance Minister and other top-level authorities keep stubbornly supporting the bank, considering it 'too big to fail'.

events.title: Email alleging obstruction in Epstein case
events.description: A person in Berlin emails the U.S. Attorney's Office alleging Deutsche Bank helped Epstein launder money and that German authorities are obstructing justice by protecting the bank and ignoring evidence submission requests.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: A correspondent from Berlin alleges Deutsche Bank AG (DB) helped Jeffrey Epstein move 'dirty money' out of the United States.

The correspondent claims German authorities, including Finance Minister Olaf Scholz, are protecting Deutsche Bank, considering it 'too big to fail,' and that German law enforcement (Bundeskriminalamt) ignored requests to submit evidence related to DB.
The email is an internal forward within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, showing the allegation was received by U.S. prosecutors investigating Epstein.
The document references a criminal money-laundering probe in the U.S. involving Deutsche Bank AG.
